results.title: Border country
results.creator_credit: Trojan Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Jill Robb and Peter Thompson
results.brief_description: A cinematic exploration of South Eastern South Australia, a region that combines the wild beauty of The Coorong with lush grazing properties, pine forests, Mt Gambier’s famous Blue Lake, and the quiet charm of small fishing villages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trojan Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Jill Robb and Peter Thompson

results.title: Bootmen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Hilary Linstead and Dein Perry
results.brief_description: Loosely based on director Dein Perry’s early life as a dancer, “Bootmen” is the story of two brothers - Sean (Adam Garcia) and Mitchell (Sam Worthington) - working in a steel mill in the industrial city of Newcastle. Both dream of one day escaping from the mill, Sean as a tap dancer in Sydney and Mitchell purchasing a tow truck to get out of the only life their stern father has ever known. Tension arrises between the brothers when Sean quits the mill to go to Sydney to study with a well known dance troupe and Mitchell moves in on Sean’s woman, Linda (Sophie Lee), both brothers finding themselves in love with her. “Bootmen” is a feel-good movie that is similar in genre to “Strictly Ballroom” and “The Full Monty”, a touching and sweet film with wonderful tap dancing sequences. Cast also includes William Zappa, Richard Carter and Susie Porter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Hilary Linstead and Dein Perry

results.title: Booom (K)
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Kamil Pixa, Peter Hollander and Bratislav Pojar
results.brief_description: An animated film taking a humorous look at a very serious subject: the global arms race. Looks at the history of aggression from caveman times to atomic missiles and the theory that might makes right.

results.brief_description: An animation in which satirist Jules Feiffer makes a pungent comment on the US arms race and military build-up. Text by Jules Feiffer, animation by Bill Plympton.

results.title: Boomsville
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Yvon Mallette
results.brief_description: An amusing diagnosis of big city growing pains. This film is an ironic view of town planning or rather, the lack of it and what has happened to our cities as a result. Done in cartoon animation, the film traces the growth of the typical city, from a tiny settlement in the vast North American wilderness to the car-clogged metropolis that so many cities are today. Awards: New York; Oberhousen; Les Menuires.

results.title: Boomerang = Bumerang
results.brief_description: Cartoon in which a butterfly causes trouble at a rocket station. This film is a satire on a military dictatorship and the perseverance of the human spirit. The soundtrack contains no music or dialogue, only sound effects. Animated by Branislav Nemet and Turido Paus.

results.title: Boomerang (A)
results.brief_description: Aborigine, Jackson Jacob (Thunalgunaldin) demonstrates and explains how a returning boomerang is made. Opens with a legend describing the origin of the boomerang.

results.title: Boomer
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Radford, Michael Scott and Dale Phillips
results.brief_description: For some of us home and work are not in the same place. Well paid as a boiler-maker, Gary Honig must often leave home to exercise his highly specialised skill. Sometimes, his wife and two daughters accompany him in their trailer but more often they remain behind in their home in Stony Creek, Alberta. The film describes how one family copes, combining family life, and work in the increasingly industrialised West.
